result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Grant E Trapani

records.addlTxt:
(Cases 21CF318, 21CF751, 22CF335, 22CF345 are called at 2:33 PM)  Defendant Grant E Trapani in court.  Attorney Katherine Cook and Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Grant E Trapani. Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates there is an agreement- recites the joint sentence recommendation. State clarifies the joint sentence recommendation. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant pleads No Contest to 21CF318 Count 1- Possession of Methamphetamine, 21CF751 amended Count 1- Theft from Person as Party to a Crime (943.201(a)(3e)), 22CF345 Count 1- Felony Bail Jumping. Court accepts pleas and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in to include 22CF335, 22FO184. 
State makes argument regarding expungement in 21CF318 and 22CF345- objects to expungement. Defense makes argument regarding expungement in 21CF318 and 22CF345. Court grants Defense's request for expungement as a condition of Probation. 
Court withhold sentence and orders 4 years Probation (concurrent to each other) with the following conditions: 180 days jail with Huber on 21CF751 Count 1, all but 30 days stayed pending further order of the court (remaining 30 days may be served by 240 hours of community service that must be completed within the first 2 years of Probation- Defendant chooses Community Service); AODA and follow through with recommendations; No contact with B.C.; No contact with co-defendant T.H.; No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting; Court orders pursuant to 973.015, record to be expunged upon successful completion of probation in 21CF318, 22CF345; Maintain absolute sobriety; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs. Court orders 2 days jail credit, if revoked in 21CF318, 21CF751. No jail credit, if revoked in 22CF345.

1:33 pm cases 21CF318, 21CF751, 22CF335, 22CF345 called. Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Grant E Trapani in court.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier and Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Grant E Trapani. The parties are close to an agreement but request another status conference. 
A status conference (possible plea) is scheduled for 6/1/22 at 2:30 PM (in person, 30 min).

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
(9:02 AM cases 21CF318, 21CF751, 22CF335, 22CF345 called.) Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Grant E Trapani in court. Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Grant E Trapani.
Court notes 2 of the cases haven't had a preliminary hearing or waiver of preliminary hearing.
Attorney Linzmeier advises the defendant will waive preliminary hearing in new cases.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in cases 22CF335, 22CF345 and Court accepts waivers.
Attorney Linzmeier advises has a new offer from the State and needs additional time to speak with the defendant.
Status Conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 1:30 pm.

(Cases 22CF335, 22CF345 are called at 11:28 AM) Defendant Grant Trepani appears in person without counsel. ADA Afton Lewis appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives reading of both complaints and updates phone number. Time limits for preliminary hearings in both files are waived. 
Pre-Trial Conference: 03/30/2022 at 1:30 PM.  Hearing: 03/31/2022 at 9:00 AM with Branch 5.

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
(Covers 22CF335 & 22CF345)
